trans-unit.source: Enter the username of the website user. This is needed to login.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le nom d'utilisateur du site web. Il est nécessaire de vous connecter.

trans-unit.source: A username is required and must be in lowercase without spaces in it. The username must be unique among other usernames in the page where it's saved. If it is not unique a number will be prepended automatically.
trans-unit.target: Un nom d'utilisateur est requis et doit être en minuscules sans espaces. Le nom d'utilisateur doit être unique parmi d'autres noms d'utilisateur dans la page où il est enregistré. Si ce n'est pas unique, un nombre sera automatiquement prédéfini.

trans-unit.source: Creating Frontend Users and Groups | https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/GettingStartedTutorial/EditAndCreatePagesAndContent/CreateUsersGroups/
trans-unit.target: Création des utilisateurs et des groupes Frontend | https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/GettingStartedTutorial/EditAndCreatePagesAndContent/CreateUsersGroups/

trans-unit.source: Enter the password for the username above. This is needed to login.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le mot de passe pour l'identifiant ci-dessus. Il est nécessaire de vous connecter.

trans-unit.source: A password is required and must be in lowercase without spaces in it.
trans-unit.target: Un mot de passe est requis et doit être en minuscules sans espaces.

trans-unit.source: Select a user group for the username.
trans-unit.target: Sélectionnez un groupe d'utilisateurs pour le nom d'utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: When a user logs in he is able to view all content which is access restricted to the user group(s) the user is a member of. Therefore the user login primarily makes sense with regard to the member groups.
trans-unit.target: Lorsqu'un utilisateur se connecte à lui est en mesure de visualiser tout le contenu qui est limité à l'utilisateur groupe(s) l'utilisateur est membre. Par conséquent, l'utilisateur se connecte principalement à l'égard des groupes membres.

trans-unit.source: Enter the host name from which the user is forced to login. NOTICE: this is not a security feature and can be circumvented by faking HTTP_HOST.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le nom d'hôte à partir duquel l'utilisateur est obligé de se connecter. AVIS : il ne s'agit pas d'une fonctionnalité de sécurité et peut être contourné par un faux HTTP_HOST.

trans-unit.source: A TYPO3 system may have multiple domains pointing to it. Therefore this option secures that users can login only from a certain host name.
trans-unit.target: Un système TYPO3 peut avoir plusieurs domaines pointant vers lui. Par conséquent, cette option permet aux utilisateurs de se connecter uniquement à partir d'un nom d'hôte.

trans-unit.source: Either a domain name, "www.typo3.org" or an IP address, "10.34.222.83"
trans-unit.target: Soit un nom de domaine, "www.typo3.org" soit une adresse IP, "10.34.222.83"

trans-unit.source: fe_groups:lockToDomain
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
trans-unit.target: fe_groups:lockToDomain

trans-unit.source: Enter the regular name of the user, both first- and surname.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le nom régulier de l'utilisateur, tant en prénom que en nom de famille.

trans-unit.source: Enter the street address of the user.
trans-unit.target: Entrez l'adresse de l'utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: Enter the homepage URL
trans-unit.target: Entrez l'URL de la page d'accueil

trans-unit.source: Enter the job title, eg. 'Director' or 'Accountant'.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le titre du poste, par exemple. 'Directeur' ou 'Comptant'.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the company in which the user is employed.
trans-unit.target: Entrez le nom de la société dans laquelle l'utilisateur est employé.

trans-unit.source: Insert a photo of the user.
trans-unit.target: Insérez une photo de l'utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: This option will temporarily disable the user from logging in.
trans-unit.target: Cette option désactivera temporairement l'utilisateur de se connecter.

trans-unit.source: fe_users:starttime,fe_users:endtime
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
trans-unit.target: fe_users:starttime,fe_users:end time

trans-unit.source: Enter the date from which the account is active.
trans-unit.target: Entrez la date à partir de laquelle le compte est actif.

trans-unit.source: The syntax is dd-mm-yy, but you can just enter a "d" in the field to insert todays date. Or "d+10" to insert the date 10 days from now etc. The field will re-format any input to fit the format it understands so you can just experiment and you will be able to clearly see how dates should be entered.
trans-unit.target: La syntaxe est dd-mm-yy, mais vous pouvez juste entrer un "d" dans le champ pour insérer la date de jour. Ou "d+10" pour insérer la date de 10 jours à partir de maintenant etc. Le champ va reformuler n'importe quelle entrée pour le format qu'il comprend afin que vous puissiez juste expérimenter et vous pourrez clairement voir comment les dates doivent être entrées.

trans-unit.source: fe_users:disable,fe_users:endtime
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
trans-unit.target: fe_users:disable,fe_users:endtime

trans-unit.source: Enter the date from which the account is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Entrez la date à partir de laquelle le compte est désactivé.

trans-unit.source: See "Start"
trans-unit.target: Voir "Démarrer"

trans-unit.source: fe_users:disable,fe_users:starttime
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
trans-unit.target: fe_users:disable,fe_users:starttime

trans-unit.source: This field shows the user's last log in date.
trans-unit.target: Ce champ affiche la dernière date de connexion de l'utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: Enter additional TSconfig for the user (advanced).
trans-unit.target: Entrez un TSconfig supplémentaire pour l'utilisateur (avancé).

trans-unit.source: This field allows you to enter TypoScript style configuration values for the user. Currently there are no system defined keys. If there ever will be, they will be described in detail in the administrative documentation. The primary use of this field (as well as the 'sister'-field in the Website usergroup table) is for custom purposes. In this case, you should use the root-key "user" for your customly defined values. Thus you don't risk any future system keys to interfere with your configuration. You access the values of the configuration from your frontend plugins by calling the function $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->getUserTSconf() which will return an array with the valuetree in it. Warning: You should use Website user/group TSconfig in your PHP-scripts ONLY if your resulting content is NOT being cached! So call it from TypoScript USER_INT cObjects or disable caching from your PHP-code by calling $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->set_no_cache(); TSconfig from Website usergroups: Notice that the configuration from the field TSconfig in the member groups of the user is accumulated and prepended to the TSconfig of the user before it's parsed. This means for instance that a key defined in the TSconfig of the user (this field) will override the same key defined in the last (bottom) usergroup in the list which will again override the same key defined in the first (top) usergroup in the list. Example: Let's imagine you want to define for a user that his name is printed in the bottom of the webpages when he is logged in. First of all you must write a PHP-function and insert the result from it as a USER_INT cObject in the bottom of the page. But your function needs to know, whether or not this user is configured to have his name printed. So you decide to use a custom TSconfig key, 'user.printUserName': In the TSconfig field of the user or usergroup: user.printUserName = 1 In your PHP-function: $userTSConfig = $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->getUserTSconf(); if ($userTSConfig["user."]["printUserName"]) { return $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->user["name"]; }
trans-unit.target: This field allows you to enter TypoScript style configuration values for the user. Currently there are no system defined keys. If there ever will be, they will be described in detail in the administrative documentation. The primary use of this field (as well as the 'sister'-field in the Website usergroup table) is for custom purposes. In this case, you should use the root-key "user" for your customly defined values. Thus you don't risk any future system keys to interfere with your configuration. You access the values of the configuration from your frontend plugins by calling the function $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->getUserTSconf() which will return an array with the valuetree in it. Warning: You should use Website user/group TSconfig in your PHP-scripts ONLY if your resulting content is NOT being cached! So call it from TypoScript USER_INT cObjects or disable caching from your PHP-code by calling $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->set_no_cache(); TSconfig from Website usergroups: Notice that the configuration from the field TSconfig in the member groups of the user is accumulated and prepended to the TSconfig of the user before it's parsed. This means for instance that a key defined in the TSconfig of the user (this field) will override the same key defined in the last (bottom) usergroup in the list which will again override the same key defined in the first (top) usergroup in the list. Example: Let's imagine you want to define for a user that his name is printed in the bottom of the webpages when he is logged in. First of all you must write a PHP-function and insert the result from it as a USER_INT cObject in the bottom of the page. But your function needs to know, whether or not this user is configured to have his name printed. So you decide to use a custom TSconfig key, 'user.printUserName': In the TSconfig field of the user or usergroup: user.printUserName = 1 In your PHP-function: $userTSConfig = $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->getUserTSconf(); if ($userTSConfig["user."]["printUserName"]) { return $GLOBALS["TSFE"]->fe_user->user["name"]; }

trans-unit.source: TypoScript syntax, without conditions and constants.
trans-unit.target: Syntaxe TypoScript, sans conditions et constantes.

trans-unit.source: TSconfig for TSFE | https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TSconfigReference/PageTsconfig/TCEmain/ pages:TSconfig, fe_groups:TSconfig, be_users:TSconfig, be_groups:TSconfig
trans-unit.target: TSconfig pour TSFE | https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TSconfigReference/PageTsconfig/TCEmain/ pages:TSconfig, fe_groups:TSconfig, be_users:TSconfig, be_groups:TSconfig

trans-unit.source: A website login user.
trans-unit.target: Un utilisateur de connexion du site.

trans-unit.source: These are users with a username and password who are allowed specific access to otherwise restricted areas on your website.
trans-unit.target: Ce sont des utilisateurs avec un nom d'utilisateur et un mot de passe qui sont autorisés à accéder à des zones autrement restreintes sur votre site Web.

trans-unit.source: fe_groups be_users
trans-unit.target: fe_groups être_utilisateurs

trans-unit.source: EXT:frontend/Resources/Public/Images/cshimages/feusers_1.png, EXT:frontend/Resources/Public/Images/cshimages/feusers_2.png,
trans-unit.note: This string contains an internal text, which must not be changed. Just copy the original text into the translation field. For more information have a look at the Tutorial.
trans-unit.target: EXT:frontend/Ressources/Public/Images/cshimages/feusers_1.png, EXT:frontend/Resources/Public/Images/cshimages/feusers_2.png,

trans-unit.source: Part of the form for editing a frontend user. A typical login box (standard) on the website where frontend users can login.
trans-unit.target: Partie du formulaire pour éditer un utilisateur frontend. Une boîte de connexion (standard) typique sur le site web où les utilisateurs frontaux peuvent se connecter.
